response:
The combination of a cervical hemicord syndrome and unilateral optic neuropathy in a middle-aged man most strongly suggests a central nervous system demyelinating disorder, but compressive, neoplastic, inflammatory, infectious, vascular, nutritional, and unrelated optic nerve pathologies must be excluded.

differential_diagnosis = ["Relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis with cervical myelitis and left optic neuritis", "Neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder (AQP4-IgG\u2013associated)", "Myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein antibody-associated disease (MOGAD)", "Right cervical spinal cord extrinsic compression (e.g., meningioma, neurofibroma, cervical disc prolapse, epidural abscess)", "Right cervical spinal cord intramedullary tumour (e.g., ependymoma, astrocytoma)", "Idiopathic or post-infectious inflammatory transverse myelitis", "Subacute combined degeneration from vitamin B12 deficiency", "Spinal cord infarction (anterior spinal artery or hemicord territory)", "Non-arteritic ischaemic optic neuropathy causing the left optic nerve findings independently of the spinal cord lesion"]
